wikipedia_page.main: Henry James Parker Montford (21 June 1863 – 1942) was an English footballer who played for Stoke.

response: Montford was signed from Welsh side Newtown in 1885 he played in eight competitive games for Stoke with five of them coming in the Football League. He left Stoke in 1890 to play for Leek. Edgar also had a brother, Harry Montford who also played for Stoke.

link_mentions.page: 1890 National League of Baseball of Great Britain
response: Edgar Montford was one of two footballing brothers who played for Stoke City in the era, Edgar was part of the Stoke City football squad of 1889-90 so it is assumed this was the brother who was a professional baseball player in the same year. Harry Montford had left Stoke City for Leek by 1890.
